intro: Andersonia heterophylla, commonly known as the dwarf fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It is a small, mat-forming herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces striking, lantern-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a contrasting central stripe. It blooms during the winter months and is adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Andersonia heterophylla is a member of the family Proteaceae and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
